===Etymology===
Shortened from {{ja-l|吠瑠璃||beiruri}}, itself from {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=るり}} {{m|ltc|吠瑠璃|tr=bjoj<sup>H</sup> liou liɛ}}, a phonetic transcription of {{etyl|sa|ja|sort=るり}} {{m|sa|वैडूर्य|tr=vaiḍūrya||[[cat's eye]], [[beryl]]}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> Some scholars suggest that the source term might instead have been {{etyl|pi|ja|sort=るり}} {{m|pi|veḷuriya||precious stone, maybe [[lapis lazuli]]}}.<ref>'''1985''', ''The Golden Peaches of Samarkand'', Edward H Schafer, University of California Press, Los Angeles, 398 pp.</ref><ref>'''1917''', ''Field Museum of Natural History: 1909'', “The Beginnings of Porcelain in China”, Berthold Laufer and Henry Windsor Nichols, The Museum, [http://books.google.com/books?id=BnEuAAAAYAAJ&dq=veluriya%20liuli&pg=PA138#v=onepage&q=veluriya%20liuli&f=false p138]:
: The glassy paste for the production of ceramic glazes was called ''liu-li'' {{lang|und|sc=Hani|琉璃}} (in the Han Annals {{lang|und|sc=Hani|流離}}) or ''p'i-liu-li'', derived from Prākrit ''veluriya'', Mahārāshṭrī ''verulia'' (Sanskrit ''vaiḍūrya).</ref>

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|るり|acc=0|acc_ref=NHK|acc2=1|acc2_ref=NHK,DJR}}

===Alternative forms===
* {{l|ja|琉璃}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|るり}}

# [[lapis lazuli]]
# the [[deep]] [[blue]] color of lapis lazuli: [[azure]]
# [[common]] [[name]] for various blue [[thrush]]es (birds) in [[family]] [[Muscicapidae]], such as the {{m|ja|大瑠璃|tr=ōruri||{{vern|blue and white flycatcher}}, {{taxlink|Cyanoptila cyanomelana|species|noshow=1}}}} or {{m|ja|小瑠璃|tr=koruri||{{vern|Siberian blue robin}}, {{taxlink|Larvivora cyane|species|noshow=1}}, syn. {{taxlink|Luscinia cyane|species|noshow=1}}}}
# {{lb|ja|sort=るり|mineral|geology}} [[lazurite]]
#: The term {{ja-l|青金石||seikinseki}} is used more specifically for this sense.

====Idioms====
{{der-top|Idioms}}
* {{ja-l|瑠璃の光も磨きがら|るりのひかりもみがきがら|ruri no hikari mo migakigara}}: “lapis lazuli's shine is brought out by polishing” → inborn talent is no substitute for hard work and practice
* {{ja-l|瑠璃も玻璃も照らせば光かる|るりもはりもてらせばひかる|ruri mo hari mo teraseba hikaru}}: “lapis and crystal sparkle when you shine a light on them” → even if two things are different, illumination can make their excellent qualities clear
* {{ja-l|瑠璃も玻璃も照らせば分かる|るりもはりもてらせばわかる|ruri mo hari mo teraseba wakaru}}: “you can tell lapis and crystal by shining a light on them” → the true nature of similar things can be discerned by different means or in different situations
* {{ja-l|瑠璃は脆し|るりはもろし|ruri wa moroshi}}: “lapis is fragile” → a metaphor for the fragility of beautiful things
* {{ja-l|瑠璃も曇る|るりもくもる|ruri mo kumoru}}: “even lapis gets cloudy” → a metaphor for how even the most excellent things lose value over time
{{der-bottom}}

====Derived terms====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-l|瑠璃色|るりいろ|ruriiro}}: [[azure]] [[blue]]
* {{ja-l|瑠璃貝|るりがい|rurigai}}: [[pelagic]] [[marine]] [[snail]]s of [[genus]] {{taxlink|Janthina|genus|noshow=1|ver=161102}}
* {{ja-l|瑠璃懸巣|るりかけす|ruri kakesu}}: a [[jaybird]], {{vern|Lidth's jay}}: {{taxlink|Garrulus lidthi|species|noshow=1|ver=161102}}
* {{ja-l|瑠璃瓦|るりがわら|rurigawara}}: a ''kawara'' [[tile]] with a [[glossy]] [[blue]] [[glaze]], commonly used in [[roofing]] in Japan
* {{ja-l|瑠璃観音|るりかんのん|Ruri Kannon}}: one of the 33 [[manifestation]]s of [[Kannon]] ({{ja-l|観音}}), the [[Buddha]] or [[goddess]] of [[mercy]], depicted standing on a [[lotus]] [[leaf]] floating in the water, with [[incense]] in her right hand and a lotus [[blossom]] in her left hand
* {{ja-l|瑠璃釉|るりぐすり|rurigusuri}}: a [[slip]] containing [[powdered]] [[cobalt]] and applied to [[ceramics]] to achieve a deep [[blue]] color after [[firing]]
* {{ja-l|瑠璃光如来|るりこうにょらい|Rurikō Nyorai}}: another name for {{ja-l|薬師如来||Yakushi Nyorai}}, the [[medicine]] [[Buddha]]
* {{ja-l|瑠璃紺|るりこん|ruri kon}}: a [[deep]] [[blue]] and [[glossy]] piece of [[lapis lazuli]]; a [[deep]] [[blue]] color, the color of [[lapis lazuli]]
* {{ja-l|瑠璃小灰|るりしじみ|ruri shijimi}}: the [[holly blue]] [[butterfly]], {{taxlink|Celastrina argiolus|species|noshow=1|ver=161102}}
* {{ja-l|瑠璃草|るりそう|ruri sō}}: [[navelwort]]: a [[flowering]] [[plant]] of [[genus]] {{taxlink|Omphalodes|genus|noshow=1|ver=161102}} in [[family]] [[Boraginaceae]], native to the [[mountainous]] regions of [[Honshū]] and [[Hokkaidō]]; alternate name for related plant {{ja-l|蛍葛||hotaru kazura}}, {{taxlink|Lithospermum zollingeri|species|noshow=1|ver=161102}}
* {{ja-l|瑠璃蛺|るりたては|ruri tateha}}: the {{vern|blue admiral}} [[butterfly]], {{taxlink|Kaniska canace|species|noshow=1|ver=161102}}
* {{ja-l|瑠璃鳥|るりちょう|ruri chō}}: the {{vern|Taiwan whistling thrush}} or {{vern|Formosan whistling thrush}}, {{taxlink|Myophonus insularis|species|noshow=1|ver=161102}}
* {{ja-l|瑠璃灯|るりとう|ruri tō}}: a kind of [[hexagonal]] [[lamp]] used in the [[Ōbaku]] [[sect]] of [[Zen]], covered in thin silk and containing a [[candela]] made of [[lapis lazuli]], and hung in the main [[hall]] of temples
* {{ja-l|瑠璃虎の尾|るりとらのお|ruri tora no o}}: “{{vern|azure tiger's tail}}”, {{taxlink|Veronica subsessilis|species|noshow=1|ver=161102}}
* {{ja-l|瑠璃繁縷|るりはこべ|ruri hakobe}}: {{vern|poor man's weatherglass}}, {{taxlink|Lysimachia foemina|species|noshow=1|ver=161102}}, syn. {{taxlink|Anagallis foemina|species|noshow=1|ver=161102}}, a low-growing [[herbaceous]] [[annual]] [[plant]]
* {{ja-l|瑠璃鶲|るりびたき|ruribitaki}}: the {{vern|red-flanked bluetail}}, {{vern|orange-flanked bush-robin}}, or {{vern|Siberian bluechat}}, {{taxlink|Tarsiger cyanurus|species|noshow=1|ver=161102}}
* {{ja-l|瑠璃溝隠|るりみぞかくし|ruri mizokakushi}}: a [[flowering]] [[herbaceous]] [[perennial]] [[plant]], the {{vern|edging lobelia}}, {{vern|garden lobelia}} or {{vern|trailing lobelia}}, {{taxlink|Lobelia erinus|species|noshow=1|ver=161102}}
* {{ja-l|瑠璃実の樹|るりみのき|ruri mi no ki}}: an [[evergreen]] [[shrub]] of [[genus]] {{taxlink|Lasianthus|genus|noshow=1|ver=161102}}, native to the {{w|Izu Peninsula}}
* {{ja-l|瑠璃ムスカリ|るりむすかり|ruri musukari}}: {{vern|azure muscari}}, a [[perennial]] [[bulbous]] [[plant]]s native to [[Eurasia]], of [[genus]] ''[[Muscari]]''
* {{ja-l|瑠璃柳|るりやなぎ|ruri yanagi}}: {{vern|waxy-leaf nightshade}}, a [[flowering]] [[shrub]], {{taxlink|Solanum glaucophyllum|species|noshow=1|ver=161102}} (&nbsp;<= {{taxlink|Solanum melanoxylon|species|noshow=1|ver=161102}})
